meanings.definition: The state or quality of being able to be counted.
meanings.sent1: Math class teaches us about countabilities.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use tools to measure countabilities in experiments.
meanings.sent3: The countabilities of cookies in the jar mysteriously changed overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a countabilities that touched everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made the concept of countabilities easy to understand with a fun game.

meanings.definition: The ability to be counted or quantified.
meanings.sent1: The store manager keeps track of the countabilities of products on the shelves.
meanings.sent2: In research, data analysts analyze countabilities to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The countabilities of stars in the sky seemed endless to the curious child.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work had a countabilities that impressed his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the countabilities of emotions in a single brushstroke.
